WFWorkflowActionParameters.WFTextActionText:
1. Spend the first 15‚Äì20 minutes at the beginning of each week to reflect on your progress from the past week and gather insights to improve this week.
2. Define what a "win" looks like for the week ahead with 3‚Äì5 big picture goals.
3. Translate each weekly goal into smaller, actionable tasks throughout the week.
4. Keep your plan dynamic and realistic‚ÄïAdd/adjust action items during the week. Reassess priorities midweek if needed.
5. ‚≠êÔ∏è Measure progress, not results‚ÄïFocus on consistency of action (input) over outcome (output). Score yourself on execution rate: What % of planned tasks have been done?

(1) Roll over unfinished, important tasks to this week.
(2) Drop or delete anything that no longer matters.

‚úîÔ∏è Reread weekly review notes from the past 4 weeks.
‚úîÔ∏è Review [Deep-Work-Machine](https://github.com/huaminghuangtw/Deep-Work-Machine).
‚úîÔ∏è Think Hour: Go to a coffee shop or new environment, bring a journal and pen, leave your phone and laptop at home. Think and journal on bigger picture questions about your life, direction, and daily actions.
‚Ä¢ My "üßê Past Year Review + üòâ Annual Planning" process naturally shifted from focusing on _what I wanted to accomplish_ to emphasizing _how I wanted to be_.
